ref_item.label: Escitalopram + RT2CK17
ref_item.description: 10mg escitalopram + 5mg RT2CK17 will be given orally and encapsulated into one capsule, once per day for 8 weeks. The capsules will be produced in the same manner as the placebo comparator by a local compounding pharmacy in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

pred_item.label: MPH + Escitalopram
pred_item.description: Participants received 5 mg methylphenidate (MPH) + 10 mg escitalopram (encapsulated into one capsule). At the 4-week visit, participants had the option to increase the escitalopram dose to 20 mg (formulated as 5 mg MPH + 20 mg escitalopram).

ref_item.label: Escitalopram + Placebo
ref_item.description: 10mg escitalopram + 5mg placebo will be given orally and encapsulated into one capsule, once per day for 8 weeks. The capsules will be produced in the same manner as the active comparator by a local compounding pharmacy in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

pred_item.label: Placebo + Escitalopram
pred_item.description: Participants received 5 mg placebo + 10 mg escitalopram (encapsulated into one capsule). At the 4-week visit, participants had the option to increase the escitalopram dose to 20 mg (formulated as placebo + 20 mg of escitalopram).

ref_item.name: Escitalopram + RT2CK17
ref_item.description: Participants randomized to active or placebo condition will be prescribed medication over the course of 8 weeks, with in-person follow-up visits at weeks 0, 2, 4 and 8, with follow-up phone calls on weeks 1, 3 and 6.

pred_item.name: Escitalopram
pred_item.description: 10 mg escitalopram, a standard antidepressant. Dose could be increased to 20 mg at week 4.

ref_item.name: Escitalopram + Placebo
ref_item.description: Participants randomized to active or placebo condition will be prescribed medication over the course of 8 weeks, with in-person follow-up visits at weeks 0, 2, 4 and 8, with follow-up phone calls on weeks 1, 3 and 6.

pred_item.name: Placebo
pred_item.description: 5 mg placebo matching the methylphenidate component.

ref_item.description: To determine whether RT2CK17 + escitalopram results in higher rates of medication adherence relative to placebo + escitalopram as measured by percentage pill count

pred_item.description: Defined as 100 * [number of prescribed pills – number of pills remaining]/[number of days between dispensing date and return date].

ref_item.description: To determine whether RT2CK17 + escitalopram results in greater consistency of adherence relative to placebo + escitalopram as measured by percentage of doses taken on schedule within 25% of the expected time interval, defined as +/- 6 hours from the participant's breakfast time

pred_item.description: The % of doses taken on schedule within 25% of the expected time interval, defined as ±6 h from when the participant usually took the medication, estimated by fitting a line to their dosing times.
